programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May take a look at increasingly popular tall hatchbacks known as crossovers. Having concluded their primary appeal is to caravanners, the duo spend a couple of days in models by Mazda and Volkswagen and try to get a feel for what life is like for the people they believe would buy one. Meanwhile, Richard Hammond drives a pair of exciting Lamborghinis in Italy - the ferocious Aventador Roadster and the limited-edition Sesto Elemento, which carries an eye-watering price tag of around 2million. Two cars are also put through their paces on the test track, with James in a modern re-creation of the classic Porsche 911 and Aerosmith frontman Steven Tyler in the rather less exotic Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Steve Backshall's Extreme River Challenge
programme.desc: The naturalist travels down the Baliem River in New Guinea from its source to the sea, hoping to encounter the ancient tribes and dangerous wildlife that live long its banks and in the surrounding jungle. He begins his journey inland at Lake Habbema, and braves some of the world's fiercest white water rapids. Along the way, he stays in a village belonging to the Dani tribe and ventures into some previously unexplored caves.

programme.title: Drug Wars

programme.title: Border Interceptors

programme.title: Top Gear

Meanwhile, Richard Hammond immerses himself in the world of Nascar at a race in Texas, and the Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG Roadster is wrestled around the test track, emitting serious amounts of noise and smoke in the process. programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May immerse themselves in nostalgia and try to prove that hot hatches from their younger days are better than today's equivalents. Jeremy grabs the keys to a Volkswagen Golf GTI, Richard takes the wheel of a Vauxhall Nova SRi and James May opts for the Ford Fiesta XR2i, and the trio set off on a road trip that includes a hill climb and a visit to a supermarket. However, their adventure concludes at an army training ground in Wales, where they and their steeds must face the heavily armed Top Gear Police Department. Downton Abbey star Hugh Bonneville blasts the Reasonably Priced Car around the test track.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the mid-engined Alfa Romeo 4C on the shores of Lake Como in Italy - but his enjoyment of the lightweight vehicle is disturbed by the arrival of Jeremy Clarkson, who demands a race against his quad bike. Jeremy also visits Belgium, putting the McLaren P1 hypercar to the test in Bruges and around the Spa-Francorchamps Formula One circuit - and its combined power output of more than 900bhp generated from electricity and turbocharged petrol V8 power is likely to cause astonishment. Meanwhile, James May spends time at Camp Bastion in Afghanistan to learn about the army's vehicle redeployment efforts, and Thor star Tom Hiddleston tries to coax the best time he can muster from the Reasonably Priced Car.

Jeremy also visits Belgium, putting the McLaren P1 hypercar to the test in Bruges and around the Spa-Francorchamps Formula One circuit - and its combined power output of more than 900bhp generated from electricity and turbocharged petrol V8 power is likely to cause astonishment. Meanwhile, James May spends time at Camp Bastion in Afghanistan to learn about the army's vehicle redeployment efforts, and Thor star Tom Hiddleston tries to coax the best time he can muster from the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Ultimate Movers
programme.desc: A Second World War anti-aircraft gun must be deconstructed on the island of Hoy, and a new concept in floating homes is sent hundreds of miles to York.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: John Heussi embarks on a complete redesign of Cheshire Constabulary's fleet of outdated forensic vans and a crime car comes in with a faulty wailer - but the fault remains elusive.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The three petrolheads demonstrate their love of small cars with a trip to Ukraine. Jeremy Clarkson chooses a Volkswagen Up for the journey, while Richard Hammond takes a Ford Fiesta and James May opts for a Dacia Sandero. On their adventure, the trio absorb the history of the Crimean Peninsula, including a visit to an old submarine pen - but the carefree exploration looks likely to become a chore when Jeremy, Richard and James are challenged to a long drive north through the expansive country, during which they must combat serious boredom. And as if that wasn't arduous enough, a new task is set when they arrive in Kiev - a trip into the wasteland of Chernobyl. This edition also features a track test of the Danish Zenvo ST1 supercar and James Blunt returns for another drive in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson heads to Italy to get behind the wheel of the exclusive, hand-crafted Alfa Romeo Disco Volante, which is made by coachbuilder Touring Superleggera and based on the manufacturer's already rare 8C Competizione sports car. Richard Hammond asserts authority over the sand dunes of Abu Dhabi in the six-wheel-drive Mercedes-Benz G63 AMG 6x6, while James May defies his status as Captain Slow by blasting two Caterhams around the test track - the minimalist entry-level Seven 160 and the full-fat supercharged Seven 620R. Comedian Jack Whitehall sets a lap time in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: This time, Russell Howard gets some new tattoos, Tim Vine strips to his waist, and Alice Levine clumsily copies the work of Leonardo da Vinci using squirty cream.

Jeremy Clarkson and James May join forces to create a public information film to promote safer cycling, with their efforts presented to a panel of experts including members of Westminster Council and Olympic gold medal-winning rider Chris Boardman. Meanwhile, Jeremy - who has promised to change his name to Jennifer if the Porsche is faster around the test track than the McLaren P1 driven earlier in the series - compares the seventh-generation Volkswagen Golf GTI to BMW's critically acclaimed M135i. Breaking Bad star Aaron Paul fires up the Reasonably Priced Car to see what lap time he can achieve.

programme.title: Ronnie Kray and the Pervert Peer
programme.desc: Fifty years ago, the Kray twins rose from small-time racketeers to head the most powerful criminal organisation London had ever seen. This documentary about the affinity between the upper echelons of society and the criminal underclass reveals how they built their empire on fear, violence and extortion - as well as Ronnie's alleged homosexual relationship with a prominent Tory peer.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The British Middle Class
programme.desc: Historian and broadcaster Tristram Hunt examines the social class's origins. He discovers how the backlash against the landed aristocracy began with a group of radical thinkers who craved progress and used their money from industry to begin a process of urban enlightenment. However, the growth of mass production led the newly moneyed leaders to move further away from the factories, beginning the trend for suburban living as a mark of status - though it meant the middle classes turning their back on where they came from.

programme.title: Shakespeare - The Legacy with John Nettles
programme.desc: The actor examines the life of the Bard, investigating key moments and trying to discover what may have happened in a seven-year gap where he disappears from historical records.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: Dag Bromberg: A City in the Forest
programme.desc: As the Red Army approached a forest in Poland toward the end of the war, they stumbled upon a massive complex containing more than a thousand structures across 25sqkm.

programme.title: Deep Wreck Mysteries
programme.desc: Using the latest technology, divers explore the remains of the troop-carrier SS Leopoldville. The ship was torpedoed in the English Channel on Christmas Eve 1944, resulting in the deaths of almost 800 American soldiers. Narrated by Russell Boulter.

programme.title: Deep Wreck Mysteries
programme.desc: The search for traces of British warship HMS Curacoa, which collided with the Queen Mary and sank 50 miles off the Irish coast in 1942. The vessel was escorting the liner, which was carrying 20,000 American troops, to the Clyde when the accident occurred, though a news blackout subsequently obscured details of the incident.

programme.title: Private Lives
programme.desc: Dr Tracy Borman, Chief Curator at Historic Royal Palaces, goes behind closed doors to reveal the private lives of six historical figures, beginning with Princess Margaret. Dr Borman discovers the real reason Margaret's relationship with RAF officer Peter Townsend came to an end, uncovers her disastrous marriage to Antony Snowden and discovers more about her love of music and devotion to duty.

programme.title: Private Lives
programme.desc: Dr Tracy Borman, Chief Curator at Historic Royal Palaces, explores Edward VIII's childhood with his overbearing father, reveals how the First World War saw him grow up in more ways than one, and explores his apparent desire for married women. She also uncovers the truth about Edward's abdication of the throne, and Wallis Simpson's infidelity, and reveals how Edward was a fashion icon of the day, examining his clothes in Kensington Palace.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and his team are venturing into the heart of Suriname, to kayak an unnamed river that will take the them through a forest unchanged for millions of years.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and a team of rock climbers head to the desert of southern Oman to attempt the first ascent of a towering escarpment, hoping to discover the rare and elusive Arabian leopard.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and the team battle through the jungle into the heart of Indonesian Borneo. Here, a remote mountain range guards caves, holding secrets that could rewrite the history of man.

programme.title: Fleetwood Mac - Don't Stop
programme.desc: Documentary looking back over the band's long career, from the early blues outfit led by Peter Green in the late 1960s, to their reincarnation in the 1970s with the line-up that went on to record the 40-million-selling album Rumours. Mick Fleetwood, John McVie, Lindsey Buckingham and Stevie Nicks reveal the truth behind the successes, failures and relationships that characterised their music and made them one of the most enduring acts in popular music.

programme.title: Meat Loaf: In and Out of Hell
programme.desc: A profile of the rock star's life and career, reflecting on the music that propelled him to fame and charting his journey from an overweight, bullied child to his larger-than-life persona and icon status. Featuring an interview and performance by the singer, as well as backstage footage from a Las Vegas concert. The film also revisits the Dallas of Meat Loaf's early years and includes insights from high school friends who reveal where the unusual moniker really came from.

programme.title: Royals on the Frontline
programme.desc: An unprecedented insight into the Royals and the armed services that fight in their name, from the early 20th century to modern-day conflicts such as Afghanistan. The first episode focuses on Prince Philip and Queen Elizabeth.

programme.title: Titanic: Stories from the Deep
programme.desc: Thanks to the use of cutting-edge technology, a unique collection of artefacts salvaged from the underwater resting site of the famous wreck suggest new stories of love, deception, fate and heroics. This first episode touches on Fifth Officer Harold Lowe. After Titanic sank, his lifeboat was one of the few to go back and pick up survivors. One of the people he saved, Renee Harris, gifted him a set of gold-plated nautical equipment as a symbol of her gratitude. Plus, a well-preserved alligator bag recovered from the wreck site containing fascinating clues about the life of its owner.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris journeys a thousand miles across Japan, starting out in Nagasaki, where the story of eastern railways began 150 years ago with the help of an enterprising Brit. In Fukuoka, he visits one of the Bullet Train's giant repair centres and in Hiroshima, he unravels what happened to its streetcar network after the world's first atomic bomb devastated the city. Along the way, Chris also meets a superstar cat and a singing conductor, while also checking into a popular trainspotter hotel and riding a steam-powered mountain railway.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Independent, a skyscraper in Austin, Texas. At a height of 690ft, it is the tallest building in the city, surpassing the 683ft Austonian, another residential skyscraper.

programme.title: Shakespeare - The Legacy with John Nettles
programme.desc: The actor examines the life of the Bard, investigating key moments and trying to discover what may have happened in a seven-year gap where he disappears from historical records.

programme.desc: Part one of two. The French general's 1798 military expedition to occupy Egypt, providing a base from which to attack English territory in the Indies.

programme.title: Surviving Alcatraz: Escaping the Rock
programme.desc: Scientists investigate a 1962 breakout from the island prison, to determine whether the escapees drowned while fleeing in a makeshift raft or if they safely made it to the mainland.

programme.title: Nazi Victory: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: The documentary concludes with an insight into Hitler's plans to modernise the German transport system, including super trains and futuristic airports.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The history of the concentration camp, charting its origins as a place to hold political prisoners through its development into a mechanised factory for mass murder. The first episode features the accounts of Polish inmates held there prior to the Holocaust, Jewish survivors and a former SS officer, who discusses being placed in charge of a firing squad.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: A look at the early stages of genocide at the camp, examining the role of commander Rudolf Hoess in the process. Despite later claiming he was only following orders, Hoess was instrumental in the development of Auschwitz for mass murder, arranging for Soviet prisoners to be brought in as construction workers and scouring Europe for more victims to kill. Featuring contributions from survivors.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: Examining the complex system the Nazis set up to implement the extermination of the Jewish race throughout Europe from 1942, with Auschwitz as the hub. The programme reveals that at other camps, including Treblinka, Belzec and Sobibor, rival commanders participated in the genocide with enthusiasm and shared ideas for the best method of mass murder.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: A look at how corruption became rife within the SS, with the money stolen from Jews finding its way into the pockets of the camp guards rather than funding the war effort. Many of the SS also enjoyed illicit sexual relationships with female prisoners. Meanwhile, Dr Mengele embarked on a gruesome series of experiments, using children as guinea pigs in his research into genetic inheritance.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A village ruin that is now pitted and scarred, a ghostly fleet of ships, a bridge to nowhere hidden in a forest and strange metal structures in a wood.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An eerie, empty country village which hides a sad secret, a mysterious tower battered by the elements and a disused railway deep beneath the streets of a city.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A settlement in Argentina destroyed by floods, a town in the US that has been erased, and a Soviet dream-town that turned into a nuclear nightmare.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A seemingly endless concrete line stretching through the French countryside, which sits as a monument to a discarded engineering advancement.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.desc: The series examining some of the UK's landmarks continues, with a look at the history of subterranean London, uncovering Roman remains, plague pits and secret bunkers under the capital's streets.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Herbert Rowse Armstrong, who was convicted of murdering his wife with arsenic. Much of the evidence against him was circumstantial and the scientific testimony remains disputed. This episode examines both sides of the case and asks whether the British justice system made a terrible mistake.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The crimes of Henri Landru, who targeted lonely and vulnerable women during the First World War. He seduced them with promises of marriage and lured them to houses outside Paris where the women vanished. With the police uninterested in investigating the disappearances, two women took it upon themselves to pursue Landru.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: A medal for bravery, a suicide pill and an unlikely hiding place all add up to a confusing time for reluctant resistance fighter Rene, who determines to flee to England with Yvette instead of the two British airmen Fairfax and Carstairs.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.sub-title: Up the Crick Without a Piddle
programme.desc: Rene and Edith are rewarded with medals by Churchill after being transported to England in place of the British airmen, and are reunited with an old friend who has changed sides.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: General Von Klinkerhoffen, tiring of the amount of Resistance propaganda in town, decides to restart the local newspaper, and appoints Rene and Alphonse to run it.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Three MGs from the 70s turn up at the garage, still covered in original factory wax. Nobody can believe it, or value them. A Morris 1000 turns up at the auction along with a TR7 V8.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An Albanian village home to Allied secret agents, devastated for resisting the Nazi war machine, and a notorious asylum in America that enforced lobotomies.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: A US Army Air Force C47 that dropped paratroopers on D-Day is at the centre of one of the UK's most ambitious warbird rebuilds.

programme.title: Surviving Alcatraz: Escaping the Rock

programme.title: Napoleon: The Egyptian Campaign
programme.desc: Part two of two. How the 1798 military expedition to occupy Egypt was ultimately defeated, but secured a lasting legacy by marking the birth of Egyptology.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.sub-title: The Viking Burial Shops of Estonia
programme.desc: Experts analyse the remains of two Viking boats, that were filled with dead bodies.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Drama-documentary revealing the most shocking and surprising murder cases in history. At the time of Jack the Ripper, London was home to some of the most terrible individuals the city has ever seen. One of the very worst was the elusive Borough Poisoner, George Chapman. Presenter Nicholas Day reveals how he was finally brought to justice.

programme.title: The Good Nazi
programme.desc: The story of Major Karl Plagge, a high-ranking Nazi officer who risked his own life to save hundreds of people, in a story reminiscent of Schindler's List.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: A look at how corruption became rife within the SS, with the money stolen from Jews finding its way into the pockets of the camp guards rather than funding the war effort. Many of the SS also enjoyed illicit sexual relationships with female prisoners. Meanwhile, Dr Mengele embarked on a gruesome series of experiments, using children as guinea pigs in his research into genetic inheritance.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A secretive underground base that concealed the power to destroy nations, and a sprawling industrial relic clinging to the edge of an unforgiving waterfall.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Shanghai Tower, which at a height of 632 metres is the second tallest building in the world, With a weight of 850,000 tons, it has been built to withstand winds of typhoon proportions.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of three preserved steam railway lines - the South Devon Railway heritage line, the Ffestiniog and Welsh Highlands Railway and the Great Central Railway. Sports scientist Megan Smith has a dream of tending the fire of a steam locomotive on the Ffestiniog & Welsh Highland Railway, and she stokes the bolier of NG143 and sets off along the 25 miles from Caernarfon to Porthmadog.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: The historian follows in the footsteps of 19th-century gold prospectors, attempting to find riches in a remote region on the edge of the Canadian arctic. He is joined on his expedition by polar explorer Felicity Aston and physiologist Dr Kevin Fong. The first challenge of the trek is to cross Alaska's Coast Mountains, where they retrace two routes set by 19th-century miners and brave icy rivers, avalanche-prone slopes and near vertical ascents.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A secretive underground base that concealed the power to destroy nations, and a sprawling industrial relic clinging to the edge of an unforgiving waterfall.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of Kansai International Airport upon the largest man-made island in the world, in Osaka Bay, Japan. Pioneering innovators from the past such as Pierre Danel, who developed a system against the pounding sea, and 19th-century mechanic Richard Dudgeon made the project possible. The development of airports including Berlin's Tempelhof Airport and London's Croydon Airport are also explored to reveal how engineers attempted this feat of engineering..

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Some of the most shocking cases connected with the regime's bloody reign, beginning with the case of Hitler's niece Geli Raubal, who was found dead in his apartment in 1931.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The events of 1944, when the death toll rose substantially. By this point, the Allies were aware of Auschwitz's purpose, and faced a difficult decision over what should be done about it. Plus, the story of the occupation of Hungary, revealing how Adolf Eichmann offered to spare a million Jews in return for certain services.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A marooned ironclad structure off the coast of England that hides a dramatic story of war and resilience, and a facility in the heart of America that helped tear apart a nation.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris takes a railway trip across Canada, revealing how 2,500 miles of transcontinental railway was built against huge odds in just a few decades, helping to join together a vast wilderness of isolated communities and create the country that exists today. He begins his journey on one of the earliest sections of track to be built, on a train that is now a lifeline for hunters and fishermen. He then sees one of the biggest, most famous trains in the world - the Canadian, before heading for the Prairies, and on to the port of Vancouver. Along the way he also searches for Winnie the Pooh, crosses raging rivers and meets the descendant of a pioneering Yorkshire family who arrived here more than 100 years ago.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Three MGs from the 70s turn up at the garage, still covered in original factory wax. Nobody can believe it, or value them. A Morris 1000 turns up at the auction along with a TR7 V8.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a North Yorkshire-based, family-run historic car auction business, which uncovers some remarkably rare vehicles in the picturesque village of Thornton-le-Dale.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Featuring the classic serial Death Can Be Fatal, with Mr Corbett as Charlie Farley and Mr Barker as Piggy Malone.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: The rhyming policeman sketch and a medical monologue from Mr Barker are the highlights in this edition of the vintage comedy.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The events of 1944, when the death toll rose substantially. By this point, the Allies were aware of Auschwitz's purpose, and faced a difficult decision over what should be done about it. Plus, the story of the occupation of Hungary, revealing how Adolf Eichmann offered to spare a million Jews in return for certain services.

programme.title: Napoleon: The Egyptian Campaign
programme.desc: Part two of two. How the 1798 military expedition to occupy Egypt was ultimately defeated, but secured a lasting legacy by marking the birth of Egyptology.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines a zebra's stripes and the wings of a butterfly, as he continues to discover nature's evolutionary anomalies.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Operation Grand Canyon with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Part one of two. The broadcaster joins a team of historians and geologists to recreate a pioneering 280-mile journey through the natural wonder that was led by explorer John Wesley Powell in 1869. Following in Powell's footsteps in the stunning yet challenging north Arizona landscape, Snow and the crew take on the area's rapids in antique wooden boats as they learn about the region's geological and Native American past.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.desc: How a well-preserved Viking ship discovered in 1904 continues to present archaeologists with new mysteries to unravel.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The case of Dr Crippen, who murdered his wife and buried her in the basement before fleeing to Canada.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Some of the most shocking cases connected with the regime's bloody reign, beginning with the case of Hitler's niece Geli Raubal, who was found dead in his apartment in 1931.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The events of 1944, when the death toll rose substantially. By this point, the Allies were aware of Auschwitz's purpose, and faced a difficult decision over what should be done about it. Plus, the story of the occupation of Hungary, revealing how Adolf Eichmann offered to spare a million Jews in return for certain services.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A marooned ironclad structure off the coast of England that hides a dramatic story of war and resilience, and a facility in the heart of America that helped tear apart a nation.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of Kansai International Airport upon the largest man-made island in the world, in Osaka Bay, Japan. Pioneering innovators from the past such as Pierre Danel, who developed a system against the pounding sea, and 19th-century mechanic Richard Dudgeon made the project possible. The development of airports including Berlin's Tempelhof Airport and London's Croydon Airport are also explored to reveal how engineers attempted this feat of engineering..

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At the Ffestiniog and Welsh Highlands Railway, manager Stephen Greig is trying to ensure that all goes to plan ahead of the opening of the new station at Caernarfon.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong build a wooden boat, following original designs for the vessels used during the Gold Rush. This vessel must carry them across hundreds of miles of treacherous lakes and rivers, including the infamous One Mile Rapids, a narrow canyon of white water and jagged rocks.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A marooned ironclad structure off the coast of England that hides a dramatic story of war and resilience, and a facility in the heart of America that helped tear apart a nation.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Experts analyse the work of engineers including Sir Nigel Gresley, who engineered the world's fastest steam train in 1938 and Eric Laithwaite, whose linear motor made frictionless travel a possibility. These innovators influenced the engineering of the Shanghai Maglev, the fastest passenger train in operation on Earth, which broke numerous engineering boundaries in its construction. Held in place by a series of electromagnets, it levitates on an air gap of 10mm and is able to reach a top speed of 431kms per hour.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: The murder in 1943 of businessman Sir Harry Oakes in the Bahamas, where the Duke of Windsor was governor at the time, and implicated in influencing the outcome of his murder trial.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The final episode examines the liberation of Auschwitz and other camps by the Soviet Red Army. However, freedom did not mean an end to the prisoners' suffering - many were mistreated by their liberators and thousands died for the want of medical treatment.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Forgotten relics from the defence of America's homeland, concealed by the banks of the Mississippi, and a concrete behemoth on the French coast that proved invulnerable to attacks.

programme.title: History Hunters
programme.desc: Documentary following father-and-son duo Dave and Steve Nuwar, who run a military antiques business. In the first edition, Dave takes a gamble when he makes one of his most expensive purchases ever. And with finances tight, the team head to Stratford fair to try and sell some treasures.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies

programme.desc: The disappearance of an illicit tin of pineapple chunks leaves the inmates horrified that there is a thief in their midst - and for a while, no one is above suspicion. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber is feeling dejected after his romantic fortunes take a turn for the worse, so Fletch tries to revive his friend's flagging spirits. However, his cunning plan has one potential drawback - it involves his own daughter. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.desc: Part two of two. Along the way they carry out the same surveying tasks as the original party with period equipment, including taking photographs with a 19th-century 3D camera.

programme.desc: The remains of a fleet of Viking boats, and the modern historians attempting to recreate them.

programme.desc: The case of George Smith, who married a succession of women and murdered them so he could inherit their wealth.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At South Devon, engineer Ray Lee is working to bring a loco back in to service. There is also a visit to the SS Kingswear paddle steamer In Dartmouth, the oldest vessel of its kind.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong finally arrive at the end of their gruelling journey in Dawson City. They set up a traditional mining camp in the heart of the gold fields, before facing their next challenge. They have just five days to find gold in an area that has already been heavily mined, and can only use the back-breaking methods of the 19th-century early pioneers.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Forgotten relics from the defence of America's homeland, concealed by the banks of the Mississippi, and a concrete behemoth on the French coast that proved invulnerable to attacks.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Airbus A380, which as the largest passenger plane ever built can carry more than 850 people non-stop nearly half-way around the world. With the largest wingspan of any commercial aircraft and four specially developed mighty turbo jet engines, the A380 weighs 560 tonnes and getting it off the ground would not have been possible without the work of past innovators such as George Cayley and Frank Whittle. Key developments in aerospace engineering - from Richard Whitcombe's energy-efficient wing-tip designs to Nasa engineers' cutting-edge control system, Fly by Wire - helped bring the A380 to fruition.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: The German police's attempts to catch a depraved and psychotic killer, who struck fear into women travelling on Berlin's S-Bahn train network during the Second World War.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: Eye-witness veteran testimony from men who served under fire on the frontline, taking viewers to the heart of iconic moments in the history of warfare. The first episode looks at the Allied invasion of Europe, which began on June 6 1944 - D-Day. British, American and Canadian troops stormed the beaches of Normandy in what would become known as The Longest Day.

programme.title: The Normans
programme.desc: Professor Robert Bartlett examines the impact of the conquest of Britain and Ireland, and learns how William the Conqueror built scores of castles and cathedrals to impose his control and intimidate the population. The ruler also commissioned the Domesday Book to survey the wealth of the land and raise revenue, and set in motion the linguistic and cultural transformation of England. The Normans blended well in Scotland, but faced fierce opposition in Wales, and promoted divisions in Ireland which some claim still exist to this day.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Documentary offering an insight into some of the events in the Bible, beginning with the story of the Ten Plagues. In the Old Testament, the Book of Exodus describes the epic battle between the prophet Moses and Pharaoh. Experts offer various various explanations for the 10 plagues of Moses and the mass exodus of the Hebrew slaves out of Egypt, a story that is a cornerstone of the Jewish, Christian, and Muslim faiths.

programme.desc: Ramani is convinced someone at the station was responsible for the hoax call to her ex-boyfriend, but Roger is sceptical and begins to worry about her state of mind. Lance and Sheelagh's drugs investigation on the Cole Lane Estate takes an ugly turn when an elderly man is attacked and suspicion falls on two local dealers - one of whom is subsequently shot dead. Serial rapist Alan Kennedy is assaulted by a friend of his first victim and responds by making a chilling phone call to Samantha.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: George is aggrieved to learn his father has cancer, and Nick saves a boy's life, but hurts himself in the process. Meanwhile, Bayleaf finds himself up in front of the magistrate.

programme.title: Cadfael
programme.desc: Feature-length drama in which the Middle Ages' answer to Sherlock Holmes sets out to investigate a slave girl's disappearance and locate a treasured relic missing from his abbey. Unfortunately, no sooner has he begun searching for a connection than a dead body turns up on his doorstep, plunging him into a mire of murder and subterfuge. Starring Derek Jacobi, Terrence Hardiman, Anthony Green, George Irving and Louise Delamere.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish dealer's daughter Vicki finds a ceremonial sword in the attic of her new flat that proves to have Scottish connections dating back to the era of Bonnie Prince Charlie. Lovejoy is approached by a man offering a generous sum for it, claiming a family connection. Later, after the item is subjected to a bungled burglary attempt investigations reveal it may hold the key to the location of buried treasure. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: An antique Berber rug spells intrigue for the roguish dealer, leading him into a world of unrequited love and umbrella stands. Meanwhile, Lady Jane splits from her husband after refusing to accompany him to Hong Kong for his new job. Virginia McKenna guest stars.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Maverick British rifleman Richard Sharpe is promoted for saving General Wellesley's life, and sent behind enemy lines to rally Spanish support. Surrounded by the French, he manages to pull off an inspiring propaganda coup in the small town of Torrecastro. Swashbuckling adventure, featuring Downton Abbey creator Julian Fellowes and starring Sean Bean and Brian Cox.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: New plumber Harry joins the gang and promptly declares Oz to be the most important person he has ever encountered - a Falklands veteran who has been to Nashville and met Country star Merle Haggard. Jimmy Nail stars, with a guest appearance by Kevin Lloyd (The Bill).

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Fraser calls off his goons and agrees to let the Magnificent Seven stay in the manor house rent-free, while Oz encounters a lady who is keen to make the most of his company. Morag Hood guest stars, with Jimmy Nail.

programme.title: Ms Fisher's Modern Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: When Graham King's wife Shirley is murdered in an explosion that almost claims Peregrine too, the investigation heats up and exposes a maze of fraudulent activity.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The sleuthing priest sets out to solve the murder of a local aeronautics magnate's son, and disaster strikes when Lady Felicia loses her singing voice. Robert Daws guest stars.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The clerical sleuth encounters a voodoo priest who is intent on winning back the woman he loves - no matter the cost. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: The chairman of the Classic Car Restoration Society is found dead alongside his beloved El Dorado with a lungful of gasoline. The investigators try to determine whether his fate was due to a petrol siphoning accident or something more deliberate. They also wonder whether it was linked to an unidentified dead body found in his garage the day before. Neill Rea and Fern Sutherland star.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: When Brackenreid leaves Toronto to help an old friend find a missing woman, he learns he's a lot closer to the case than he thought.

programme.title: Life on Mars
programme.desc: Sam and the rest of the CID unit get to work in an effort to prove Gene's innocence when he becomes a suspect in a murder case. But as the investigation continues, further evidence is stacked up against Hunt, leading to a conclusion that rocks the very foundations of the detective's already fragile world. John Simm and Philip Glenister star.

programme.title: Life on Mars
programme.desc: Sam questions the ethics behind the team's methods when their attempts to catch a murderer lead to some inevitable problems, but a private meeting with Morgan leads to revelations that turn the detective's world upside down - and offer him a chance to go home. Last-ever episode of the fantasy drama, starring John Simm and Philip Glenister.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The resourceful barrister defends an Army chaplain accused of murdering his brother. His efforts are not exactly helped by the client's refusal to speak - leaving him to wonder whether he is suffering from shell-shock brought on by a tour of Bosnia or whether he has something to hide. Starring John Thaw, with John Wood, Richard Pasco, Lisa Harrow and Nicholas Jones.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: Robert begins a career as a journalist and Geoffrey joins a gym to help Hetty solve a case for her hairdresser, whose errant husband has a lot to hide following an apparently random attack in a gents' toilet.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The sleuth goes to North Yorkshire to meet her long-lost cousin Kate, and ends up investigating a case of demonic visitations. Amiable Geoffrey joins her in an attempt to provide moral support - and is soon drawn into his own little mystery.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Lizzie must deal with her mother's bold defence of the York cause, while the appearance of a boy in Burgundy claiming to be a young prince threatens to further destabilise King Henry's rule. King Henry's mother Lady Margaret Beaufort faces the consequences of harbouring a dark secret. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Dr Cameron feels increasingly isolated as the day of Janet and Angus's wedding approaches and Dr Finlay is drawn toward the new National Health Service. Rural medical drama, starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gina warns Amber not to tell a soul about her cancer, but any hopes of keeping her illness secret are dashed when she's prescribed a course of daily radiotherapy. Scott reacts badly to the news that Greg's murder charges have been dropped, and Lance's latest assignment on the Cole Lane Estate proves something of a damp squib. Gabriel gives Sheelagh the brush-off, while Reg isn't quite sure what to make of Sun Hill's eager new receptionist Julian Tavell, known as JT.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Honey can't bring herself to contemplate the terrifying prospect that fiance Scott might have murdered his first wife, despite Yvonne and Steve's suspicions that there might be something to Greg's allegations. Lance tries to get the Cole Lane Estate's teenage population interested in cricket, hoping to bridge the generation gap and recruit informers at the same time, but his best efforts are jeopardised when Gary sets up a bungled drugs bust.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: PC Dan Casper arrives at Sun Hill, and immediately risks life and limb to rescue a girl attempting to kill herself on a dual carriageway. Unfortunately, despite his best efforts, the case has a tragic ending. Scott manipulates Honey into setting a date for their wedding, and Gina tells Smithy she's suffering from cancer, while Gary makes himself unpopular by criticising the boys in uniform.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: JT unwittingly puts a woman's life in jeopardy by sending her to the house of serial rapist Alan Kennedy, forcing Samantha and Terry to abandon a covert surveillance operation and rush to her rescue. Reg and Tony arrest two squabbling burglars and Smithy urges Gina to give up smoking, while Ramani is astounded to overhear Margaret and Roger discussing her love life - or lack of one.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates

programme.desc: The sleuth goes to North Yorkshire to meet her long-lost cousin Kate, and ends up investigating a case of demonic visitations. Amiable Geoffrey joins her in an attempt to provide moral support - and is soon drawn into his own little mystery.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's A Dinner of Herbs
programme.desc: First in a two-part drama, starring Billie Whitelaw as a herbalist who takes an 11-year-old orphan under her wing. The youngster soon makes friends with a local girl and the future looks rosy - but heartbreak is waiting just around the corner. With Tim Healy, Jonathan Kerrigan and Michael Jayston.

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: The amateur sleuth is presented with a fresh challenge to her deductive powers while holidaying at the plush Bertram's Hotel in London - a case involving a cleric whose disappearance is seemingly linked to an Irish train robbery. Feature-length mystery, starring Joan Hickson, Caroline Blakiston and Joan Greenwood.

programme.title: The Casual Vacancy
programme.desc: Tensions rise in Pagford as the parish council election approaches and each side steps up its campaign, with the fate of Sweetlove House hanging in the balance. Meanwhile, Miles pines for a quiet life and promises Samantha that once the vote is over everything will calm down, but she doesn't believe him, and Howard's dark secret is revealed in the Ghost's final post. Krystal returns home to find Terri back to her old ways, Hope seems more fragile than ever and news of a tragedy leaves the whole community reeling.

programme.title: The Last Post
programme.desc: The NLF want to make a trade. Alison watches over Ed, feeling conflicted over their marriage. Yusra smuggles a coded message to Armstrong, and Joe goes against his orders.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: King Henry VII and Lizzie travel to Spain to secure their son's betrothal, but find news of their country's instability has preceded them. Meanwhile, unrest growing in Burgundy spills over into an English battle. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The daughter of a man held responsible for a fatal boating accident on the Thames comes forward with new evidence, claiming that a property developer sabotaged the vessel. The case means putting Strickland's wealthy sailing friends under the spotlight, much to the team's delight. Guest starring Barbara Flynn (Cranford).

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits one of the National Gardens Scheme participants, Clearbeck House in Lancashire, where beautiful sculptures blend with the flowers and wildlife.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Paddy Garvey is awarded his medal at Buckingham Palace, and an old flame returns into Major James McCudden's life. Starring Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The men take part in a training exercise in dealing with chemical weapons, and the arrival of a new soldier in the regiment brings trouble.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Ramani is convinced someone at the station was responsible for the hoax call to her ex-boyfriend, but Roger is sceptical and begins to worry about her state of mind. Lance and Sheelagh's drugs investigation on the Cole Lane Estate takes an ugly turn when an elderly man is attacked and suspicion falls on two local dealers - one of whom is subsequently shot dead. Serial rapist Alan Kennedy is assaulted by a friend of his first victim and responds by making a chilling phone call to Samantha.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: The VRSA infection spreads rapidly around the hospital, and when Chrissie stumbles onto the source of the outbreak, Michael resorts to desperate measures, destroying hospital records and attempting to make her a scapegoat. Zubin leaves Paris's funeral to answer an emergency call, and Jess decides their relationship has no future if he keeps putting his job first. Devastated by her rejection, he decides to leave Holby for good.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A pregnant woman's life hangs in the balance as staff struggle to diagnose her condition. Two sisters squabble over their father's estate and a fisherman experiences bizarre hallucinations. Medical drama, starring Derek Thompson.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Mickey Webb, now working with the National Crime Squad, returns to Sun Hill and tells Jack he suspects Neil has ensured the silence of a key witness in a major money laundering trial. Alan Kennedy sets a trap for Samantha, luring her to a deserted warehouse and holding her at knifepoint, while Ramani's suspicions about Margaret grow after a witness statement goes missing.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pat learns she is to appear at the Crown Court, while Sam goes back to live with her mum.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: The guilt over lying to his family about his affair with Mrs Hewitt takes its toll on Arthur, while Pete has to make a big decision about his relationship with Rose.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Kevin gets trapped in a shop that has collapsed under the weight of scaffolding. He calls Nick, who has already arrived at the scene and is trying to rescue people from the rubble.

programme.desc: Shocked at the waste in the Glenbogle house, from six-course breakfasts to separate rooms for the dogs, Stella embarks on a money-saving mission. As things start to fall apart and the staff picket the estate, Archie decides to back his friends, refusing to buckle under the new regime. Alexandra Gilbreath and Alastair Mackenzie star.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Charlie summons Jim back to Jersey to investigate the mysterious disappearance of a business associate's wife. Initial investigations reveal a lack of fidelity on the woman's part, that could involve colluding with one of Charlie's commercial rivals. Drama, starring John Nettles and Terence Alexander.

programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Convicted murderer Charlie Walker seizes his chance to escape while in transit across the moors. The next morning a barmaid is discovered dead - leaving the duo to figure out whether she was killed by the fugitive. Tim Healy and Lynda Bellingham guest star.

programme.title: New Tricks

programme.desc: Part one of two. The Cold Case squad investigate a murder dating back to World War Two. programme.desc: Mandy persuades Aden to ditch his football practice and spend time with her, which has consequences. Ricky struggles to cope with losing Sam and turn to his friends for advice.

The 'Glenbogle Three' are arrested as a result, and Molly's legal abilities are put to the test as she defends them in court. Scottish drama, starring Richard Briers, Alastair MacKenzie and Susan Hampshire.

programme.desc: Jim unwittingly finds himself caught up in a drug operation while babysitting a pair of difficult girls in the South of France. Drama, starring John Nettles, Therese Liotard and Pippa Guard.

programme.desc: Lionel is concerned that he has no pension plans, so the ever-resourceful Alistair comes up with an ingenious idea - to sell the country house. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.desc: Sir Ian Rochester is infuriated when an interesting case is handed to Deed by new presider Sir Monty Everard, and takes his anger out on Jo. She is forced to cut her ties with John after she is brought before a disciplinary committee on trumped-up charges.

programme.desc: Charlie helps a charity appeal for a war hero, while a newspaper advert lands Jim with a disreputable client, much to his regret. Crime drama, starring John Nettles.

programme.desc: A worrying event back home involving his wife forces Michael Stubbs contemplate his priorities. Starring Robson Green and Rob Spendlove.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The lads receive an emergency call while on jungle manoeuvres Down Under, and rush off to Hope Bay, the village adjacent to their camp, which has just been devastated by a cyclone. Taylor manfully puts affairs of the heart on hold to supervise rescue operations, but unfortunately, not everyone can be saved.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Margaret falls down a flight of stairs during a tussle with an increasingly harassed Ramani, who has become convinced she's being stalked. Neil returns to Sun Hill, and Yvonne agrees to a date with nurse Nick, only to leave him in the lurch. Samantha and Terry find themselves in a room full of venomous snakes, while Gina faces an ordeal of a different kind as she prepares to start chemotherapy.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: A new surgeon arrives at the hospital, and Connie is outraged to learn that not only has he been given Loftwood's position, but he's also getting her office. Lola is angered by the news that Cleo is moving in with her boyfriend, while Dean begins to doubt his ability to cope with the job. However, the pair seek solace from their frustrations by having dinner together.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A little girl with a broken arm and three professors beaten up by a jealous quiz rival have a Christmas they'd much rather forget, while the staff of A&E welcome a new arrival. Away from work, Tina and Sean get to know each other better at the party, while George and Mark clear the air. Hospital drama, starring Claire Goose and Rebecca Lacey.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gary investigates the alleged rape of a 13-year-old girl and discovers she lied about her age. At his urging, the accused confess to sex, hoping to be treated leniently - only to end up facing a possible life sentence. Honey's fiance Scott Burnett is arrested for murdering his wife, while Ramani is interrogated by Adam and Gina about events leading up to Margaret Barnes' fall - and suffers the added trauma of learning Roger has accused her of deliberately causing the incident.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Rachel makes her final preparations to leave the square, while Michelle wonders if she made a mistake by letting Jack get too emotionally attached to her.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Set in a community in London's East End, these are the beginnings of Britain's favourite soap; intertwining relationships, social issues, triumphs, tragedies, loves and losses.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Maggie returns from Thailand with her new toy boy. Bayleaf is found not guilty in court, while Jean and Sicknote continue to get along swimmingly.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: In a bid to drum up more visitors, Archie invites a journalist to stay at Glenbogle and write a review of all the activities on offer, but things don't go to plan, as he turns out to be none other than Stella's ex-husband. Drama, starring Alastair Mackenzie and Alexandra Gilbreath.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim agrees to chauffeur Charlie to an 80th birthday party in France that turns out to be more eventful than he anticipated. Detective drama, starring John Nettles and Terence Alexander.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: The Boswell boys are in love, and Oswald is confused by Aveline's overnight transformation into a career woman.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: The opening day of the season arrives and staff gather to welcome the first guests at Maplin's holiday camp. Comedy, starring Paul Shane, Sue Pollard and Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Penny and Stephen have big news which may prevent them attending Alistair and Judith's wedding, while Lionel's father Rocky and Mrs Bale prepare for the big event in the village. Comedy, starring Judi Dench, Geoffrey Palmer, Philip Bretherton and Moira Brooker.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Variations on a Theme of Father's Day
programme.desc: Convinced that Nelly is his mother, Hobbo sends Howard to eavesdrop on her and Pearl as he tries to find out more about his father. However, when the women concoct some false information, the police start to take an interest in the men's activities. Comedy, starring Russ Abbot, June Whitfield and Robert Fyfe.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: When Brackenreid leaves Toronto to help an old friend find a missing woman, he learns he's a lot closer to the case than he thought.

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: A boxer dies in the ring, but what looks like a simple medical case causes Lucien to be pulled into intrigue as he begins to suspect the man was murdered. Australian detective drama, starring Craig McLachlan.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A reluctant Brian enters an addiction centre run by monks to treat his alcoholism, but soon becomes bored and looks for a distraction. He finds one when a chance remark leads the team to reopen an investigation into the death of a heroin user nine years previously - and to help reveal the truth, Gerry is sent undercover as a sex addict. Richard Wilson and Fay Ripley guest star.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Part one of two. A psychiatrist treating a disturbed woman on trial for killing her family asks the team to investigate possible links to a double murder committed three years ago. Enquiries lead to a mysterious man convincing mentally unstable women to kill. Paul Kaye, Laurence Penry-Jones and Lucy Gaskell guest star, with Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gary investigates the alleged rape of a 13-year-old girl and discovers she lied about her age. At his urging, the accused confess to sex, hoping to be treated leniently - only to end up facing a possible life sentence. Honey's fiance Scott Burnett is arrested for murdering his wife, while Ramani is interrogated by Adam and Gina about events leading up to Margaret Barnes' fall - and suffers the added trauma of learning Roger has accused her of deliberately causing the incident.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Maggie returns from Thailand with her new toy boy. Bayleaf is found not guilty in court, while Jean and Sicknote continue to get along swimmingly.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the stunning Rowden Gardens on Dartmoor - one of the participants in the National Gardens Scheme.

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny's dare is take to the wheel of a high-powered sports car, but can he drift it and avoid the forfeit?.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Thinking he's hunting down a rat in his attic, Magoo finds himself on the theme park, devoted to... the glory of Fizz..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo comes across Fizz encased in ice and thinks he has found a prehistoric man. He thaws him out and acts like a caveman, so as not to distress him..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks he's helping out at an understaffed veterinary clinic. In fact, he's at the supermarket, where Fizz is trying to sell his cleaning products..

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Miss Wince takes Mrs. Wicket off on holiday in her brand-new, swanky caravan; and Bean is left behind. But never one to let a setback knock his confidence, he decides to build his own caravan and sets off in search of the perfect 'quiet spot'. All would be well if he'd only not built the caravan out of Mrs. Wicket's garden she.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Grandpa Max's engineer buddy Phil Billings gifts Team Tennyson the Omni-Copter, a state of the art flying vehicle.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania
programme.desc: Mavis accidentally lures an unwelcomed guest into the hotel.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined by singer Jack Savoretti, who chats and performs. Chefs Richard Bertinet and Nisha Katona also drop by, along with pie-maker extraordinaire Calum Franklin.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry Firth and Ian Theasby serve up pastaball marinara - their take on meatballs in tomato sauce - baked banana French toast topped with berry compote, crispy chilli tofu and special fried rice, and peanut butter and jelly chocolate brownies. Their guest is chef Meriel Armitage, who prepares barbecue glazed jackfruit ribs.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team create a cleverly designed family garden that's full of fun for pre-school tots without being a primary-coloured plastic eyesore for the grownups who share it. Alan, David Domoney, Katie Rushworth and Frances Tophill also give tips on creating a mini-maze, creative sandpits and how to use plants to give an adventurous exotic flavour to play areas.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A masterpiece by landscape artist Henry Hogson causes a stir when it is auctioned for 400,000 after a fierce bidding war - and hours later, its former owner is tortured and killed. When a Hogson work is then stolen, Barnaby and Jones research the Midsomer painter with the help of art teacher Matilda Simms. They soon uncover evidence of forgery - but the killer is still at large. Guest starring David Bamber and Susannah Harker, with John Nettles and Jason Hughes.

programme.title: Goldfinger (1964)
programme.desc: James Bond is assigned to investigate a notorious German gold smuggler and discovers his quarry has ambitions much greater than first suspected. Pursuing the criminal mastermind around the world, Bond uncovers the villain's audacious scheme to destroy the global economy with a daring attack on Fort Knox. Spy adventure, starring Sean Connery, Gert Frobe and Honor Blackman.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: A special edition of the game show in which host Stephen Mulhern invites comedy pairings to take place. Inside No 9 stars Steve Pemberton and Reece Shearsmith, Danny John-Jules and Robert Llewellyn of Red Dwarf fame and Nina Wadia and Lynda Baron, who co-star in Still Open All Hours, are the famous duos taking part. As usual they try to guess the popular phrases in the hope of scoring enough points to win a cash prize for their charity of choice - and making it through to the Super Catchphrase to play for 50,000

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: Absolutely Fabulous star and travel presenter Joanna Lumley joins the boys as Star Guest Announcer, while Fleur East surprises another lucky viewer by turning up on their doorstep to offer them a Place on the Plane, ahead of the season-ending spectacular at Walt Disney World in Florida. Stephen Mulhern hosts a surprise stunt at a mystery location in London, and the Men in Brown continue on their intergalactic quest to find out which celebrity has The Squits. Plus, one lucky audience member plays to Win the Ads.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the opening Knockout round, as 12 acts perform for a place in the live Semi-Final. Coaches Will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, Olly Murs and Meghan Trainor all return to their infamous red chairs as the acts they have chosen from the blind auditions and the Battle Rounds fight for their place on their coach's team.

programme.title: American Gangster (2007)
programme.desc: The story of 1970s drug kingpin Frank Lucas, whose innovative methods of smuggling heroin into the US made him one of the leading figures in the New York underworld. A detective is assigned to bring Lucas's empire down, but his investigation is undermined by police corruption. Ridley Scott's fact-based crime drama, starring Denzel Washington, Russell Crowe, Chiwetel Ejiofor and Josh Brolin.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny's dare will see him attempt a bungee jump, but has he got the nerve to launch himself off the side of the Tees Transporter bridge?.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: In order to make himself an object of worship, Fizz makes people believe he's an alien coming to share his wisdom..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks that the whole neighbourhood has been flooded, when in fact he is just at the local swimming pool..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo, on a construction site, thinks he's been hired for a medieval theatre show. Fizz and Weasel bump into Magoo at the top of the tower..

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is trying to impress some kids in the park with his football skills but winds up kicking their ball into a dilapidated, scary-looking house..

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Ben runs into an old bully, Kevin 11, who now has new powers.

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda: The Paws of Destiny
programme.sub-title: Unholy Dragon Returns to the Mountains
programme.desc: Hoping to find the wellspring, Jindiao takes Po and the students hostage to learn their secrets..

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania
programme.desc: Mavis finds her childhood toy, Demented Debbie, in the attic.

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott concludes his culinary tour of Antigua, picking up some of the island's famous black pineapples from a fruit and vegetable stall to make a lobster pina colada with rum, and visiting a hilltop cookery school, where he makes a rum butter cake. The Carribean tour concludes at the famous sunset party at Shirley Heights, where he prepares one last cocktail recipe.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry Firth and Ian Theasby serve up creamy seaside pie - their take on fish pie - and also prepare chilli and nachos, big burrito cake filled with sweet potatoes, smoky peppers and spicy rice, and finish off with their New York-style cheesecake topped with strawberries. Their guest is Rachel Ama, who cooks her harissa hotpot - aubergine cooked in a hot and spicy sauce.

programme.title: Griff's Great Australian Adventure
programme.sub-title: Indian Pacific: Kalgoorlie to Sydney 'What Makes an Australian?'
programme.desc: Comedian, actor and travel enthusiast Griff Rhys Jones continues his journey across Australia on the Indian Pacific. He visits Adelaide, Broken Hill and finally Sydney to discover the unique and diverse definitions of what makes this great nation.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the opening Knockout round, as 12 acts perform for a place in the live Semi-Final. Coaches Will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, Olly Murs and Meghan Trainor all return to their infamous red chairs as the acts they have chosen from the blind auditions and the Battle Rounds fight for their place on their coach's team.

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: Absolutely Fabulous star and travel presenter Joanna Lumley joins the boys as Star Guest Announcer, while Fleur East surprises another lucky viewer by turning up on their doorstep to offer them a Place on the Plane, ahead of the season-ending spectacular at Walt Disney World in Florida. Stephen Mulhern hosts a surprise stunt at a mystery location in London, and the Men in Brown continue on their intergalactic quest to find out which celebrity has The Squits. Plus, one lucky audience member plays to Win the Ads.

programme.title: Peter Pan (2003)
programme.desc: The adventures of the boy who never grows old, as he whisks Wendy Darling and her brothers away to the magical world of Neverland - where they come face to face with fearsome Captain Hook. Adaptation of JM Barrie's fantasy novel, starring Jeremy Sumpter, Rachel Hurd-Wood, Jason Isaacs and Lynn Redgrave.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a celebrity edition of the game show, asking contestants James Jordan, Fiona Wade and Louis Walsh to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000 for their chosen charity.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Nina Wadia, Linford Christie, Sarah Harding and Tyger Drew-Honey pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: The Good Karma Hospital
programme.desc: After months away with her family, Ruby returns to the hospital for her pregnant sister to give birth. However, when a life-or-death medical crisis unfolds, she is forced to decide where her loyalty lies. Meanwhile, Greg gets a surprise family visitor. Medical drama set in southern India, starring Amrita Acharia, Neil Morrissey and Amanda Redman.

programme.title: Belgravia
programme.desc: Drama about the secrets and dishonour among the upper echelons of 19th-century London society, adapted by Julian Fellowes from his novel of the same name. The year is 1836 and the Trenchard family have recently ascended to the aristocratic society of London's Belgravia - only for a 26-year-old love affair to come back to haunt them and jeopardise the happiness of many. Starring Tamsin Greig, Philip Glenister and Harriet Walter.

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Hidden Caribbean: Havana to Haiti
programme.desc: Part one of two. The actress travels across two of the most enigmatic countries in the Caribbean - Cuba and Haiti - to explore, uncover and share the hidden gems they have to offer. Joanna kicks off her adventure in a Havana boxing gym with one of Cuba's rising female boxing stars. She visits the stars of the cabaret at the National Hotel that pre-dates the revolution, and entertains the cigar workers while they roll cigars in their factory. She visits the small town of Hershey, built on the success of the sugar industry, and visits the tomb of Che Guevara before heading off to Hemingway's favourite beach.

programme.title: Harry Redknapp's Sandbanks Summer
programme.desc: Harry Redknapp goes on a camping trip to Brownsea Island with his family, where he plans to catch and cook dinner for the whole family. After taking his grandson fishing, he heads for a cookery masterclass with head chef of the nearby Rick Stein restaurant. The next day, Harry and his son, Jamie Redknapp compete in a game of crazy golf.

programme.title: Six Nations Highlights
programme.desc: Jill Douglas is joined by Gordon D'Arcy, Ugo Monye and Gareth Thomas to present action from Wales v Scotland at Principality Stadium in the fifth round of fixtures.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A team of five singers answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: TV presenter Anthea Turner looks back on her career and talks about turning 60, getting married again and her special relationship with her stepchildren.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and topical studio discussion from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder's Crime Stories
programme.desc: Barrister Robert Rinder examines more real-life cases, beginning with the 2001 murder of 15-year-old Danielle Jones, who went missing on her way to school.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five car insurance claims handlers from Swansea answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Bryan, Liz, Hayley and Jay pit their wits against a ruthless quiz genius in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Laurel makes Arthur apologise to Nicola for the trouble he's caused Jimmy in front of the kids, while Andrea prepares to record Kim's confession. Sam and Lydia ask about the whereabouts of Sam's ring and Vanessa feels determined to head to work on the last day before her treatment begins.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Alya is shocked when Yasmeen reveals that she is moving to Cyprus with Geoff, and tries to make her see that he trying to separate her from the people who care about her. Claudia sets up Ken for a fall at a Literary Society talk. while Bernie realises that Gemma isn't coping, and Michael enjoys spending some time with Grace and Tianna.

programme.title: St Davids - Britain's Smallest City
programme.desc: Tourists flock to go wildlife spotting on Ramsey Island as the holiday season is in full swing, while the Women's Institute tuck in to an insect-fuelled feast at the bug farm. Siriol Jenkins narrates the documentary about the people who live and work in the city of St Davids in Pembrokeshire.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Alya begs Yasmeen to leave Geoff and come home with her, and reports him to the police, convinced he must have a history of abuse. Evelyn and Tyrone take Cerberus to the vet, where Evelyn bumps into old flame Arthur, while Norris tries to recruit Ken's help, despite having sabotaged his talk.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Haunted by nightmares of Andrew and harassed by the journalists lurking outside her flat, Laura's world begins to turn in on her. When Winnie makes a surprising confession to her, together they follow a trail of evidence in the hope it will hold answers as to what is going through Carl's mind. But press interest and Katy's volatility threaten to derail Laura's progress. Will she learn what brought Carl and Andrew together, and the tumultuous consequences of that meeting? Thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt.

programme.title: The Station: Trouble on the Tracks
programme.desc: Documentary following the staff of Network Rail, which operates the country's railway tracks, focusing on Birmingham New Street station. Engineers battle the elements after extensive flooding, while beleaguered staff deal with stranded passengers demanding answers. Graffiti artist Banksy leaves Birmingham rail engineers a gift spray-painted on to one of the walls - all done under his usual veil of secrecy - and train manager Adam is faced with a passenger without a ticket.

programme.title: Broadchurch
programme.desc: Hardy and Ellie appeal to Trish to be more open with them as she may have information that - although not related to the attack - could help the investigation, but she is unwilling to co-operate. The officers of Broadchurch CID are slowly making their way through the painstaking process of interviewing witnesses and collecting statements and start to uncover inconsistencies and lies - and previously hidden connections between Trish and some suspects. Crime drama, with David Tennant, Olivia Colman and Julie Hesmondhalgh.

programme.title: Dr Ranj: On Call
programme.desc: Dr Ranj Singh offers more advice on how to spot, treat and deal with some of the most common illnesses and accidents. As well as going over the latest medical news, he joins the West Midlands Ambulance Service to help with emergency calls, while Kylie Pentelow meets a young patient whose life was saved thanks to incredible advancements in 3D printing.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh surprises a group of senior citizens in Thornton Heath, turning an urban wasteland into a welcoming oasis of swaying grasses and pretty daisy flowers. The experts share tips on how to achieve the look of a miniature prairie even in a tiny space, the tricks to creating a cost-effective water feature from skip material, and how to choose the best low-maintenance shrubs to green up even the shadiest of spots.

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Hidden Caribbean: Havana to Haiti
programme.desc: Part two of two. Joanna completes her Cuban journey by visiting the infamous town of Guantanamo. Giving the prison a wide berth, she discovers that the song Guantanamera was born in the town, and meets a talented young singer who is recording the track herself. She then heads across the Windward Passage to Haiti, currently the poorest country in the Western World. She visits the Citadel, a mighty fortress built to deter colonial powers, before taking in a Voodoo ceremony on the Iles a Vaches.

programme.title: Belgravia
programme.desc: Drama about the secrets and dishonour among the upper echelons of 19th-century London society, adapted by Julian Fellowes from his novel of the same name. The year is 1836 and the Trenchard family have recently ascended to the aristocratic society of London's Belgravia - only for a 26-year-old love affair to come back to haunt them and jeopardise the happiness of many. Starring Tamsin Greig, Philip Glenister and Harriet Walter.

programme.title: The Trouble with Maggie Cole
programme.desc: Maggie wants to apologise to everyone she has upset, and decides to go and visit GP Carol Tomlin. The radio interview has gone viral and the village is left reeling from the revelations. Jill bonds with other fellow members of the 'outed six', Marcus and Roxanna. Meanwhile, Neil and Kelly embrace what was broadcast and pretend that they are lottery winners, and later, Maggie discovers the truth about Dr Carol's marriage. Starring Dawn French, Mark Heap, Chetna Pandya, Vicki Pepperdine and Emily Reid.

programme.title: Australian Wilderness with Ray Mears
programme.desc: Ray heads deep into the Australian Outback discover how both people and animals have developed ways to thrive in otherwise challenging conditions. He begins in Western Australia, where 20 million years ago, the sea bed erupted to create the great limestone cliffs of Ningaloo. Amid the rocks, the presenter encounters the fossils of giant prehistoric sharks, before swimming with their modern descendants - the whale sharks - out on Ningaloo reef.
